Comments_List: Since it is type of seminar class, We only have one presentation throughout the semester.
2 hours per week
1hour
The total number of hours I spent on this class was about one hour every week on average.
2-3 hours
About 1 hour.
On average, I spent 2-3 hours per week on this course.
Unless I am leading the discussion, ~30 minutes.
1 hour
3 hours
1 hour
I believe it is really a great chance to communicate with the students among the same major about some interesting studies.
Covers a range of topics, which is very good.

I think that the course is fine, but I think that we should receive course credit for it.  The course took a lot of time for zero credits.  I also found most of the lectures to be outside my area of interest.  Rather than take this course, I would prefer to read articles and attend lectures about topics that are closer to my research.
I do feel that this course benefits MPH students more than doctoral students. It does not go into depth as far as methods, etc. as you might expect from a doctoral-level journal club.

Strength:
The guest the seminar invited every time helped me understand their fields of public health, which broad my horizon, especially get in touch with the front line of public health research. Also, the students were asked to give a lecture on a specific subject, which was a good chance for students to dive into a specific case, also, this format effectively trained the ability of presentation. 
Weakness:
When a student gave a lecture, the participation of other students were reduced, since for the topic the presenter give, needless to say he or she understood it very well since she or he had made some preparations on that, however, the topic or the knowledge for other students is a little bit ambiguous and hard to understand.
This course is honestly the biggest waste of my time. I am not learning at all.
good to know the latest research result in related field
Very useful for us to understand our future research field.
EHS students should not have to have this commitment every week for no credit. We should have a 3x per semester speaker. This course every week should be for credit.
This course provides a wide range of knowledge about the latest scientific research in the field of environmental epidemiology. The journal club has improved the engagement of students.
this seminar and journal club is great in letting us know more about the environmental health

It's great that we have excellent speakers from different areas and interests. I learned a lot from each one of them. I wish instead of hold biweekly journal clubs, we could have more speakers to come and talk about what they are passionate about, and what is the outlook on many domains of EHS.
Lectures speakers are always quite interesting. Student presenters are dedicated, but discussion often is difficult to stimulate.

Because this course meets every week but we receive no credit, there is little time to complete the outside readings. Furthermore, the topics are often extremely specialized and difficult to understand.
Dr. Chen is a good instructor for this two-year seminar class and I really enjoy her class.
Professor Chen is a very good at leading discussions and raising questions for students to think over. She is also good at pointing out important concepts and let people make note of those.
Very helpful and responded to emails very quickly.
Professor Chen is very responsible and patient. The suggestions she gave to each student is detail oriented, which helped each student to find their problems and make specific improvement.
There is no instruction, there is only students giving presentations on subjects that would be great if I wanted to be a researcher in the future. But I don't so they are honestly not applicable.
good
Professor Chen is very helpful to guide us to understand the latest researches in the environmental health area.

Dr. Ying is a really helpful and nice instructor. She always considers for the students. She is responsible and has tried her best to make the students engaged in the class. The classroom is lively. She invited several guest lecturers to give lectures in this course, which provided the students with the latest knowledge about environmental epidemiology.
Dr. Chen is always nice to talk to. She comes prepared for each journal club and lead the discussions during class.
Enthusiastic, extremely knowledgeable, very approachable.

This class is not really led by the instructor so it is difficult to assess her performance. I think if she is in charge of selecting speakers and relevant articles that this could be changed to better reflect the interests and understanding level of the students in the course
It is really a good opportunity to discuss some current interesting topic in our filed of study, so I highly recommend this class to all students.

kind of unnecessary.journal club should just meet every other week its a waste of our time. we are extremely busy students so you should save the money you spend on lunch every week and just offer this every other session when we have guests
Very informative. Would recommend.
Rather than take this course, I would recommend reading articles and attending lectures on the areas of research of interest.
I would tell that student that if they absolutely have to take this as a requirement that they should bring some work to class so they don't fall asleep.
good
I will recommend it to other students.
It's mandatory

Yes, I recommend this course to other students. This course provides a wide range of knowledge about the latest scientific research in the field of environmental epidemiology. The journal club has improved the engagement of students.
It is a very useful course with a lot of health information and trending issues. I highly recommend this course to other students since you can meet
There is a broad range of topics covered in this seminar. You can attend the ones you are interested in, and it won't disappoint you.
This course does not require much outside work. Depending on your interests and level of hard-sciences background you may get more or less from the topics presented.
